post_text:
NEED HELP WITH GOOGLE CLASSROOM?

Parents, Google Classroom is your child's digital link to learning. Teachers use this platform to share assignments, homework, newsletters, and much more!

Please watch the video below to learn

- How students log in
- Viewing assignments
- Turning in assignments
- Grades
- How students keep track of their work

Need help finding Google Classroom codes?

Please visit the District website (www.cicd99.edu), click on the schools tab, and click on the school your child attends.

Once you're on your school's website click on the TEACHERS TAB up at the top and scroll down to find your child's teacher by either grade level or subject.

NOTE** Not all teachers use Google Classroom codes, if there are no codes for your child's teacher please check your REMIND APP or call your child's school!

#ignite99 #ilumina99

Once you're on your school's website click on the TEACHERS TAB up at the top and scroll down to find your child's teacher by either grade level or subject.

NEED HELP WITH IMAGINE AND SPLASH MATH?

‚ûó Imagine Learning Math offers engaging, effective math instruction designed to help early-learners learn/love math while building conceptual understanding and problem-solving skills with the support of a live teacher and delivers math fact fluency within a fun, exciting game-based environment.

‚ûï SplashLearn/Math transforms the way elementary school children in grades K-5 learn and study math through a highly engaging, and personalized program.

‚ûñ Parents please click on the pictures below then click on the link attached to watch videos that will help your child learn more about this learning platform that Cicero District 99 provides to help all students grow in mathematics.

LAST WEEK OF THE D99 SUMMER CHALLENGE üòé‚òÄÔ∏è

With two weeks of summer left and before #RemoteLearning starts on Monday, Aug. 31, Cicero District 99 encourages all students to participate in the #D99SummerChallenge!

Superintendent Rodolfo Hernandez wants to thank all of those who have maximized their extra time, utilized flexible learning spaces and gotten a jump start to the new school year.

More information on raffle prizes which include bikes, board games, restaurant gift certificates and more will be announced in the upcoming weeks.

For those who have not participated, this is your last chance to complete the challenge! You can visit the #D99SummerChallenge web page for a list of all the assignments/projects!

post_text:
EMBRACING THE NEW NORMAL: CAR PARADE OFFERS D99 FAMILIES CHANCE TO CELEBRATE REMOTE LEARNING START TO YEAR üöóüéâ

For Cicero District 99, the unprecedented shift to full remote learning for the start of the school year doesn't mean students and staff still can't start the year off on a positive note ‚Äî an attitude evident Saturday, Aug. 8 as the District hosted a Back to School Car Parade for families of the district at Unity Junior High School.

From 11 a.m.-1 p.m., families were invited to a drive-through parade, where attendees enjoyed live music and had the chance to take home 3,000 goodie bags filled with snacks and school supplies.

The drive-through event replaced the District's annual Back to School Fair, which typically hosts thousands of community members flocking in-person to Unity's campus for food, carnival games and socializing with fellow community members and District staff.

#ignite99 #ilumina99 #KeepLearning

Only HALF of Town of Cicero has been counted in the #2020Census!

It is up to ALL Cicero residents to fill out the census, so residents are no longer underfunded or misrepresented!

Census takers will start knocking on doors on August 11, but you don't have to wait! You can fill out the census online, by mail, or over the phone until October 30.

https://my2020census.gov/login

Don‚Äôt miss your chance to get counted in 2020!

#CookCountyCensus #MakeILCount #TrueForYou #GetCounted

All members of the public wishing to listen to the board meeting may dial 1-414-882-6725

When prompted, access dial code: 576 068 564#

Once connected to the meeting, you are required to mute yourselves. At the time of public comment, you may unmute yourself and state your public comment.

Please note: Per Board Policy 2:230, all public comments are limited to three minutes.

post_text:
GOING, GOING, GONE
THOUSANDS TURN OUT FOR FIRST FREE FOOD BOX DISTRIBUTION

Locals of all ages flocked to Unity Junior High School on Thursday, June 25 for District 99's first day of the Free Food Box program, a summer partnership between District 99, local municipal leaders and the Greater Chicago Food Depository to help provide healthy food for area children and families in need.

Each Thursday through July 30, District 99 and GCFD are partnering with Cicero, Cook County and State of Illinois leaders under the Families First Coronavirus Response Act for the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Field to Table popup distribution program.

Distribution runs from 10 a.m. to noon, with 1,000 boxes of fresh produce, dairy and meat products are given away on a first come, first served basis.

#ignite99 #ilumina99 #AllInThisTogether

EXTRA, EXTRA!

Cicero District 99 and Columbus East Elementary School Principal Donata Heppner were recently featured in an article on WeAreTeachers, an online media brand for educators committed to one of the toughest, most rewarding jobs out there.

So far, over 60% of the entire country has responded to the #2020Census, which comes out to nearly 202 million people!

In the state of Illinois, 66% (8 million people) have filled out their Census.

Here in the Town of Cicero only 37,000 out of our roughly 82,000 (46%) residents have filled out their Census, which means there are still a lot of Ciceronians who need to fill it out.

Cicero District 99 added 133 new photos.
June 15 at 3:41 PM ¬∑

Administrators and staff members from Cicero District 99 and Unity Junior High School celebrated the Class of 2020 with a special celebratory drive through graduation parade on Saturday, June 13 in the front of Unity's main entrance.

Recent grads were joined by family members in their cars for the chance to have a proper in-person sendoff from teachers and administrators!

Based on the excitement and success of this weekend's parade, Superintendent Rodolfo Hernandez and Unity are hoping to make the event a new annual tradition!

You can watch the entire Graduation Parade by clicking here:
https://bit.ly/3fvkvzL

#ignite99 #ilumina99 #ThisIsUnity #ClassOf2020

post_text:
To stay in compliance with the State of Illinois' approach to safely reopen our state, Cicero District 99's regular board meeting scheduled for Wednesday, June 17 will be held virtually beginning at 6:30 p.m.

All members of the public wishing to listen to the board meeting may dial (256) 600-8302

When prompted, access dial code: 899 930 048#

Once connected to the meeting, you are required to mute yourselves. At the time of public comment, you may unmute yourself and state your public comment.

Please note: Per Board Policy 2:230, all public comments are limited to three minutes.

#ignite99 #ilumina99

post_text:
Happy Thursday Cicero!

On Monday and Tuesday, Unity's Athletics Department acknowledged all student athletes who made a spring sports team by delivering signs to their front lawn which stated, "A proud student-athlete lives here,‚Äù along with a designation of their sport!

To make the signs special for Unity graduates, all signs for eighth graders had a graduation cap attached to their specific sport logo.

Additionally, the Special Olympics basketball team also received trophies for being 2020 state qualifiers. Although they didn‚Äôt get the chance to compete due to the state tournament being cancelled, District 99 knows they would have brought home a trophy!

As always, Superintendent Rodolfo Hernandez is proud of the efforts of District 99's student athletes, believing that participation in sports and extracurriculars helps provide children a strong foundation to become the leaders of tomorrow.

#ignite99 #ilumina99 #ThisIsUnity

post_text:
Did you miss the 3 p.m. live experience? Don't worry - we have an encore for you!

Join Ted Ehnle (coordinator of Fine Arts), Ashley Stopczynski (music teacher at Columbus East), and Ed Warble (music teacher at Unity) for an hour-long show of student artwork and musical performances from all District 99 schools!

Please click below and take some time to check out the entire Virtual Art Galley, located on the District website.

www.cicd99.edu/about-district-99/fineartsfestival

As always, Superintendent Rodolfo Hernandez is proud of the steadfast commitment of the District's arts educators, as well as the enthusiastic participation of students in the arts programs. Hernandez knows that dedication to the core studies is important, but hopes productions like the Fine Arts Festival ‚Äî whether in person or virtual ‚Äî prove to community the value of arts in public education.

Cicero District 99 would like to congratulate and recognize it's 2020 National Junior Honor Society Members.

Since 1929, NJHS has been America's top academic organization dedicated to recognizing middle-school students designated by their schools as outstanding youths. Aside from achieving honor-roll status, students inducted into NJHS are nominated by their teachers for membership for demonstration in the areas of scholarship, service, leadership, character and citizenship.

Enjoy the show!

Are you having trouble filling out your #2020Census online?

The U.S. Census Bureau has phone numbers you can call to speak to a representative who can help you fill out your census right over the phone.

üìû For English: 1-844-330-2020
WATCH: https://bit.ly/3gqxiER

‚òéÔ∏è For Spanish: 1-844-468-2020
WATCH: https://bit.ly/2X4YWQ9

Town of Cicero President Larry Dominick has also put together a Census Committee that include town officials, local nonprofit leaders and members from Cicero District 99.

Please click on the images below to view messages from Cicero town officials Jose Alvarez, Jessica Jaramillo, Maria Punzo-Arias, Blanca Vargas and Ismael Vargas to learn why making #CiceroCount is so important.

Please visit our District's census website for further information on what the census is all about!

https://bit.ly/3e2pvv3

Typically during the school year, District 99 likes to highlight teachers and staff who either grew up in Cicero and are happily giving back to their hometown community, or who decided to work in District 99 after finding the students and staff to have made such a unique educational community.

But during these trying times, District 99 wanted to take the time to properly recognize the District's essential workers ‚Äî those who are helping the District run like a well-oiled machine, despite the challenges presented by COVID-19.

Join District 99 in thanking the Buildings and Grounds, Food Services, Security, Technology and Transportation departments for their continued hard work and drive to go above and beyond for the students, staff and families of District 99!

#ignite99 #ilumina99 #AllInIllinois #CiceroStaysHome

COME GET YOUR FREE MASK

*First come first serve, while supplies last

Join Superintendent Rodolfo Hernandez, District 99 Board President Tom Tomschin, Cicero Town President Larry Dominick, Cicero Township Committeewoman Blanca M. Vargas, and Cook County Comissioner Frank J. Aguilar to get one of the 6,000 masks being distributed this morning.

Special thank you to the Dr. Willie Wilson Foundation for donating all of the PPE masks and Frito-Lay for donating thousands of bags of chips to also distribute to the community.

We would also like to thank all of the Town of Cicero's Parent Patrol Volunteers, Cicero Community Outreach Department, Gee Get Money and our local first responders for helping hand out all that is being given away today while practicing #socialdistancing

#ignite99 #ilumina99 #AllInThisTogether #CiceroStrong

post_text:
SAVE THE DATE

In compliance with Illinois' stay-at-home order and social distancing protocols, Cicero District 99's regular board meeting scheduled for Wednesday, May 20 will be held virtually beginning at 6:30 p.m.

All members of the public wishing to listen to the board meeting may dial 1-559-921-9538. When prompted, access dial code 855 301 008#.

Once connected to the meeting, you are required to mute yourselves. At the time of public comment, you may unmute yourself and state your public comment.

Please note that per Board Policy 2:230, all public comments are limited to three minutes.

#ignite99 #ilumina99

All members of the public wishing to listen to the board meeting may dial 1-559-921-9538. When prompted, access dial code 855 301 008#.

Once connected to the meeting, you are required to mute yourselves. At the time of public comment, you may unmute yourself and state your public comment.

post_text:
#FEELGOODFRIDAY

Cicero District 99 is proud to announce that two Unity Junior High School students have been awarded scholarships to attend Nazareth Academy in west suburban LaGrange Park!üéì

üèÖEmmanuel Rodriguez, who also attended Abraham Lincoln Elementary School, received the CSJ Scholarship, which is awarded to the top test takers on Nazareth Academy's entrance exam. In addition, a $5,000, $3,500 or $2,000 cash benefit will be applied to their tuition, and will be rewarded annually upon continued academic excellence.

üèÖSoleil Salgado, who also attended Drexel Elementary School, received the Unity award, which is given to incoming Nazareth Academy freshmen who are proven student leaders. In addition, a $1,000 cash benefit will be applied to their tuition and will be rewarded annually upon continued leadership.

To see all award recipients, click the link below to watch the video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XRgfS3_rpIo&feature=emb_logo

#ignite99 #ilumina99 #ThisIsUnity #IgnitingTheRoadToExcellence #CreateYourLegacy

post_text:
Week 3 of #remotelearning officially begins today and Cicero District 99 students are doing whatever it takes to #KeepLearning

1Ô∏è‚É£We would like to thank the hundreds of parents that joined Mr. Hernandez and other District officials last Friday for their Virtual Coffee Talk!

2Ô∏è‚É£We realize that a lot of our community may still have questions in regards to how the District is planning for the future. We assure you that information will be provided as soon as it becomes available RIGHT HERE on our Facebook page, our Twitter page (https://twitter.com/D99Cicero), our District website (www.cicd99.edu) and through our robocalling system.

3Ô∏è‚É£We also have a phone hotline that you can call to speak with administrators who can help answer any questions. You may contact them at (630) 729-7970

4Ô∏è‚É£Please continue texting your photos with IGNITE99 at (708) 762-3488 so we can continue sharing photos of what students are learning at home!

HAPPY EARTH DAY! üåéüåçüåè

Students from the Early Childhood Center worked together with their families to make their school mascot, Ollie the Owl, out of recycled materials around the house with items like shoeboxes, cereal boxes, toilet paper rolls, bottle caps, paper plates and more!

Earth Day is an annual event celebrated around the world to demonstrate support for environmental protection.

Cicero District 99 wants to wish our entire community a Happy Earth Day! We encourage all District students to #KeepLearning the many ways to protect the globe, just like our early childhood and pre-kindergarten students are!

#ignite99 #ilumina99 #EarthDay50 #DiaDeLaTierra

While our school buildings remain closed for in-person instruction, academic opportunities through remote learning are continuing to provide students with a variety of ways to engage with the school community.

Through the coming weeks, Cicero District 99 will continue working tirelessly to make sure no child is denied their right to a quality education!

DON'T FORGET ‚Äî visit the District's website daily for new and updated information to answer any questions you may have: https://www.cicd99.edu/about-district-99/covid19

ü•™ Food Distribution is still taking place on Mondays and Wednesdays from 8-10 a.m. at the same locations and will continue through the rest of the 2019-2020 school year.

üì≤Text IGNITE99 to (708) 762-3488 to share your remote learning photos! The strongest photos will be shared on the District's website and social media accounts. Check out this week's picks in this post.

#ignite99 #ilumina99 #KeepLearning #AllInThisTogether #AllInIllinois #StayHomeAndStaySafe

Yesterday morning, teachers and administrators from across District 99 revved up their engines for a Car Parade, saying "hello" and sharing inspirational messages with the community on how much their students are loved and supported despite school not being in session due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Along the routes, students and their families also joined in on the fun, sharing their own sweet messages of support right back at their educators!

Now that's igniting the road to excellence!

Click through to see photos from Burnham, Cicero East, Cicero West, Columbus East, Columbus West, Drexel, Lincoln, Warren Park and Wilson!

#ignite99 #ilumina99 #KeepLearning #AllInIllinois

post_text:
This morning, District 99 had a very special guest, SarahBella Abad, come to Unity to pass out treats to District essential workers, like lunch staffers and bus drivers, who distribute food to Cicero families every Monday and Wednesday. SarahBella is the daughter of Sonia Abad, supervisor of the Transportation Department.

District 99 would also like to give another huge shoutout to the Buildings and Grounds crew, led by Brian Dominick, for coming to work every weekday to ensure all District buildings are cleaned and sanitized. They even dropped off a special book delivery from Bernie's Book Bank so Cicero students have books to read at home to #KeepLearning!

#ignite99 #ilumina99

In compliance with Illinois' stay-at-home order and social distancing protocols, Cicero District 99's regular board meeting scheduled for this evening will be held virtually beginning at 6:30 p.m.

All members of the public wishing to listen to the board meeting my dial (516) 630-3623. When prompted, access dial code 860 046 386.

Once connected to the meeting, you are required to mute yourselves. At the time of public comment, you may unmute yourself and state your public comment.

Please note that per Board Policy 2:230, all public comments are limited to three minutes.

#ignite99 #ilumina99 #KeepLearning

post_text:
In response to the global coronavirus pandemic, so much of our daily interactions have transitioned from in-person to online ‚Äî including students' education.

But while colleges and universities have offered eLearning for years, this concept is relatively new for elementary students.

Tune in to "The Jen Weigel Show" tonight at 7:20 p.m. on WLS-AM 890, where District 99 Superintendent Rodolfo Hernandez will be LIVE discussing how Cicero District 99 is ahead of the curve technologically, providing students a seamless transition into eLearning during this unprecedented time!

#ignite99 #ilumina99 #KeepLearning

post_text:
Cicero District 99 students have been working hard to #KeepLearning despite the unprecedented challenges COVID-19 has brought to our community.

Now that Spring Break is over, it‚Äôs time to officially begin Remote/eLearning across the district on Monday. District 99 teachers and administrators have been working tirelessly to ensure students receive the best quality education with all of the resources we have.

Regularly visit our website, www.cicd99.edu, for updated information on school closures, meal pickup locations and phone numbers where you can contact us if you need assistance.

Parents ‚Äî please continue texting IGNITE99 to (708) 762-3488 to share your photos and videos of your child learning so we can share them on our website at https://www.cicd99.edu/about-district-99/keeplearning, and on social media throughout the coming weeks!

Lastly, if you have not already done so, please fill out our Parent Survey so we can help better accommodate all of your needs: bit.ly/d99covid19

Thank you. Stay safe and healthy!

ATTENTION DISTRICT 99 FAMILIES:

In order to better meet student and parent needs, District 99 is asking families to participate in a brief online COVID-19 Parent Support Survey.

The District is working hard to support the community through this challenging time, but needs your help to provide insight into how the District can more efficiently help its families.

Results from the survey will be used so the District can modify its eLearning plan, plan professional development and train instructional and communication platforms.

Click the link below to access the survey.

UPDATE: A Message from Superintendent Rodolfo Hernandez (March 30)

Superintendent Rodolfo Hernandez shares his message of hope for the District 99 community during this coronavirus pandemic, along with a tentative update for the school schedule.

District 99's Spring Break is this week, Monday, March 30-Friday, April 3.

eLearning will pick up again on Monday, April 6 and last through Thursday, April 9. Friday, April 10 will continue to be a regularly scheduled non-attendance day.

Continue to stay tuned to the District's website (https://www.cicd99.edu/about-district-99/covid19), Facebook and Twitter for futher updates on eLearning, messages from the District and tentative return to school dates.

#ignite99 #ilumina99 #KeepLearning

post_text:
UPDATE: Two people affiliated with District 99 diagnosed with COVID-19

On Tuesday, March 24, the District was alerted that there were two confirmed cases of COVID-19 within the District 99 community ‚Äî one affiliated with Warren Park Elementary School, and one affiliated with Abraham Lincoln Elementary School. The families are following the quarantine guidelines of the Illinois Department of Public Health, and all appropriate agencies have been notified. District 99 continues to encourage families to self-isolate through stay-at-home measures.

At this time, the last presumed contact in the school building occurred no later than March 13. We are not at liberty to share additional information due to the confidential nature of individuals' health records. We ask that you reach out to your health care provider on general guidance on how to proceed, if you have specific concerns related to potential contact and/or symptoms.

Once again, to report COVID-19 cases or contact the District office, contact (708) 863-4856 or (708) 762-2241.

DISTRICT 99 EDUCATIONAL EXPECTATIONS DURING SCHOOL CLOSURES:

At this time, if a student has questions regarding their assignments or activities, they should reach out directly to their teachers through Schoology or Google Classroom.

Teachers will be available Monday-Friday from 10-11 a.m. and 2-3 p.m.

HOW PARENTS CAN HELP SUPPORT STUDENT WORK AT HOME:

In addition to completing the activities assigned by teachers each day, we are recommending that students spend at least ONE HOUR doing math and ONE HOUR reading.

For links to all District 99 technology platforms during school closures, please visit the District website by clicking below. This webpage provides all CHROMEBOOK AND HOTSPOT information as well.

https://www.cicd99.edu/parents/e-learning

post_text:
IMPORTANT UPDATE: During the afternoon hours on Sunday, March 15, District administrators were informed that a parent of two students who attend District 99 schools was in contact with an individual that tested positive for COVID-19.

At this time, there are NO REPORTS OF THE PARENT OR STUDENTS EXHIBITING SYMPTOMS OF COVID-19. The family is following the recommendations from the CDC.

Cicero District 99 is working to ensure the well-being of everyone, please adhere to the guidelines per the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention:

If you think you have been exposed to COVID-19 AND develop a fever and symptoms, such as cough or difficulty breathing, call your healthcare provider for medical advice.

More detailed information on this incident is available by reading the letters attached to this post. These letters are also shared on the District website, cicd99.edu.

post_text:
UPDATE ON CORONAVIRUS:
District events closed to parents and public, Parent University cancelled

****Parent Teacher Conferences, scheduled for Tuesday, March 17 will be done remotely via Google Hangout video or phone conference. There will be NO on-site conferences at any schools. Parent letters were sent home Thursday, March 12.

-Unify Fridays Open Gym that is hosted by Cicero Community Outreach at Unity Junior High School is cancelled indefinitely.

-Extracurricular activities, including after-school clubs and athletic events, will continue as planned at this time, but will NOT be open to parents and the public

-Parent University is CANCELLED for Saturday, March 21, and will be rescheduled at a later date to be announced

At this time, there have been no reports of COVID-19 to District 99 administration.

Thank you for your continued support, flexibility and vigilance as we partner with you to ensure the health and safety of your children.

Last week a small group of students from District 99 had the chance to join Chicago Blackhawks players as special VIP guests at the 12th annual Brent Seabrook ICE (Inner City Education) Program Bowl at Lucky Strike Chicago.

Students eligible for the celebration were those who played hockey and skated for free twice a week at Cicero's Bobby Hull Community Ice Rink as long as the put in two hours of tutoring with Inner City Education mentors beforehand.

Click below for more photos! üì∏

#ignite99 #ilumina99

post_text:
D99 Special Olympians spend afternoon with DePaul hoopers üèÄ‚õπÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

The Unity Junior High School Special Olympics basketball team took a trip to Wintrust Arena near McCormick Place in Chicago on Friday, Jan. 31 to watch the 12th-ranked Depaul University women's basketball team take on Creighton University of Omaha, Ne. for Special Olympics Illinois night.

Though the Blue Demons fell short for only their third loss of the season, District 99 students got to visit with Dibs (DePaul's mascot), throw T-shirts to the crowd with the DePaul University Softball team, and appear on the Jumbotron, showing off their dance moves.

#ignite99 #ilumina99 #soy99
text:
D99 Special Olympians spend afternoon with DePaul hoopers üèÄ‚õπÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

The Unity Junior High School Special Olympics basketball team took a trip to Wintrust Arena near McCormick Place in Chicago on Friday, Jan. 31 to watch the 12th-ranked Depaul University women's basketball team take on Creighton University of Omaha, Ne. for Special Olympics Illinois night.

Though the Blue Demons fell short for only their third loss of the season, District 99 students got to visit with Dibs (DePaul's mascot), throw T-shirts to the crowd with the DePaul University Softball team, and appear on the Jumbotron, showing off their dance moves.

#ignite99 #ilumina99 #soy99

THE POWER OF LOVE ‚ù§Ô∏èüíùüíûüíò

Last week, love was in the air at both Liberty and Sherlock elementary schools.

Parents and grandparents flocked to Liberty's gymnasium for a Sweetheart Dance filled with dancing, sweet valentine-themed treats and crafts. And at Sherlock, parents of third graders joined their students for interactive Valentine's Day-themed math activities filled with sweet treats, puzzles and coloring.

post_text:
"Growing up, I wasn't a straight-A student. I struggled a lot. As a teacher, I constantly ask the kids, 'Do you understand it?' 'Do I need to work with you more?' And I try to reach out to them more than [I did] when I was growing up."

Elvia Arellano is the true definition of D99's Very Own. She grew up in Cicero and attended Columbus East, Columbus West and Unity. And, not only did she student teach in Cicero before beginning her career in District 99, but she also proudly teaches alongside some of her own former teachers!

#ignite99 #ilumina99 #D99sVeryOwn

"Lezley is this force of nature. She is quiet and she is calm, but her control over her students is amazing. She has been the role model for me in so many ways in that she has taught me how to just stay calm in those moments that can get very elevated." - Jill Miller, principal of Cicero East

While Lezley Harmon's tenure in District 99 may not be as long as those of others, she has proven herself a kind and selfless leader in the two schools she has worked in for her five years in Cicero.

See what sets her apart from the rest as this month's Employee of the Month, part of the D99's Very Own series.

#ignite99 #ilumina99 #D99sVeryOwn

post_text:
Calling all actors in grades 6-8! üé≠üé¨

Parents ‚Äî does your child love to act? If so, get them over to Unity this afternoon to audition for this spring's show, Shrek The Musical Jr.!

Auditions will be held today from 4-6 p.m. in Unity's west cafeteria. Open roles include: main cast members, backup singers, backup dancers, set designers and stage crew.

At the audition, kids will sing a familiar song, learn and perform a short dance, and read one piece of dialogue.

A signed permission slip is required. Extra copies are available in the office at each school building. Rehearsals will be in February, March and April.

Final performances of Shrek The Musical Jr. will be at the Town of Cicero Community Center on April 24 and 25.

Pictured (left to right): Ashley Stopczynski, stage manager (Columbus East); Karen Levin, director (Cicero West); Kayla King, choreographer (Warren Park); and Josh Lopez, music director (Warren Park and McKinley). Not pictured is Louis Ingratta
(Not Pictured) Louis Ingratta, set design/stage crew (Sherlock).

WHEN: Next Friday, Feb. 7 from 5:30-7:30 p.m. in the Unity Junior High School Gymnasium

You can also get monetary pledges for your participation in D99's Walk for Water. Come walk with us and learn about water facts and the needs of others around the world!

So come have fun in our bouncy house, listen to music, play games, and raise money for a great cause!

Raffles will be given and snacks/refreshments will be sold.

WATCH VIDEO: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AxfEVXNm_-4

This event is sponsored by District 99 Service Learning Clubs and the WE movement!

post_text:
SOUNDS OF WINTERüéºüéπü•Åüé∑üé∫üé∏üéª

Last Thursday, nearly one hundred students from across District 99 participated in the annual Winter Band Concert.

The bands were broken down into three groups (beginning, intermediate, and advanced) playing various instruments such as clarinets, flutes, percussions, saxophones, trombones, trumpets, and tubas.

The crowd enjoyed classical songs from Beethoven and Mozart, Christmas carols, and popular kid songs.

Wonderful work and great job to band directors Nancy Deladesmo (Cicero West), Mike Greenstone (Roosevelt), Josh Lopez (McKinley/Warren Park), and Angel Melendez (Burnham).

A special thank you goes out to our school board President Mr. Tom Tomschin for playing, motivating, and inspiring our Beginner's band.

"My oldest son did attend Cicero public schools, and I always admired the environment that he was in. I thought, ideally, it would be great to work for a place like this."

Over the past 21 years, Lissette Cruz has served as a program assistant, clerk and secretary across several schools in District 99.

And at this month's board meeting, she was recognized for her outstanding work as the District's Employee of the Month.

Lincoln parents ‚Äî next time you see Mrs. Cruz in the office, make sure you give her a wave and say 'hello!'

"I enjoy working with the staff, the students. I've made a lot of good friends, met a lot of good people, met a few princesses along the way, and I enjoy my job."

For the past 31 years, Cicero native Chester Bolociuch has been dedicated to his many roles within the Buildings and Grounds Department here in Cicero District 99.

From the halls of Drexel as a student, to helping with upkeep in the halls of several schools across District 99, Bolociuch has surely made his mark in Cicero!

post_text:
In Cicero District 99, addressing the concerns of student mental health is a top priority.

That‚Äôs why this past fall, District 99 began a partnership with Riveredge Hospital to host a roundtable discussion, titled School-Based Mental Health.

The roundtable's goal is to bring awareness to mental health and crisis prevention measures to leaders from school districts (including many in West 40 ISC #2) and health agencies across the area.

This initiative is ongoing, with District 99 preparing to host its second roundtable in April.

Participants from the fall 2019 roundtable included: Pillars Community Health, Oak Park Elementary School District 97, LADSE, Elyssa's Mission, J. Sterling Morton High School District 201, School District 89, Golf School District 67, Rhodes Elementary School and more!

#ignite99 #ilumina99 #soy99 #mentalhealth #suicideprevention #mentalhealthawareness
